Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, great location (overall would give it a 3.5)”
Reviews.Author: m-and-m-2004
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine, and we would consider staying here again. Nice lobby, but the upper-floor corridors and rooms have seen better days. Our room was clean, though, and all staff seemed friendly and responsive. The location is superb. All in all a decent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jan P
Reviews.Content: Booked a double room in the SORAT Hotel Ambassador and were not disappointed. Our room was spacious and very clean. Had a great night sleep, comfortable matrasses and pillows. The bathroom had a large bathtub in it which was nice. The reception desk-staff was always helpful and polite. During our stay we had breakfast in the hotel once, and it was great with a lot of variety. The location of the hotel itself is good, with a Metro station and the KaDeWe department store nearby. It is located in a safe area. Would stay here again when in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Jackyboy98
Reviews.Content: Great location next to Ka De We, free wifi and very helpful staff. The price is also very good for what you get. An older hotel, but clean and comfortable. Nothing to fancy, but staff are very helpful in helping you get around the city as well as with making arrangements such as dinner reservations, taxis, etc. Great value for money as well, would recommend to anyone looking for a hotel in the center of town.

Reviews.Title: “Does its job perfectly.”
Reviews.Author: Hyperdanny
Reviews.Content: A typical “good” German 3-star hotel. Location; a very quiet, if not terribly attractive, side street off Wittenberg Platz (and its subway station), just a stone’s throw from KaDeWe and all the hustle and bustle of the Zoo/Ku’Damm area, but thankfully not in the middle of it. Featureless 60’s building, but inside it’s been redone recently. Both the common areas and the rooms are done in the modern streamlined style fashionable now, but kind of brightly and pleasantly colored, think about a Mercure hotel and you’ll get the picture. Young staff, a mix of Germans and Eastern Europeans, all extremely nice, helpful and professional. I got there at 11 a.m. and they gave me my room right away, a big plus if you come in with an early morning flight. Rooms are fairly spacious, with big windows, very functional if not plush or luxurious and spotlessly clean. (as it is all the rest of the place, actually). I didn’t have breakfast, so can’t comment. Right next to it there an empty block where apparently they’re starting a new building, but I wasn’t bothered by any noise.

Reviews.Title: “Quality 3*** hotel in one of the best localles of Berlin West”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Maneh_Tours
Reviews.Content: Yes this is true that hotel ventilation is not of the best quality, but this is being 100% compensated by location, very professional reception staff, cleanness, comfortable beds, and more. I will definitely want to stay at this hotel again (provided that prices do not jump up)

Reviews.Title: “At Berlin IHIF”
Reviews.Author: Victoria_Toia
Reviews.Content: Forget about the WIFI in rooms, unreliable and most of the times does not work, although them mention it in the website. Bathroom smelled terrible when I arrived, I had to ask for another room but the hotel was full.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, Central location”
Reviews.Author: Sagrr A
Reviews.Content: Brilliant service at the hotel, the staff were really courteous, printed bus/train schedules and arranging a cheap taxi at 5am. They did an early check-in (3 hrs early) and helped me plan my Berlin sight seeing trip :) This is extremely centre, right next to the Berlin zoo. Metro is just a street away, so is bus 100 - the tourist bus. Room was comfortable and bathrooms were well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Moderate hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew H
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers great value and was relatively easy to find; I actually stumbled right on it. Getting there from the airport via public transportation was quite easy. Once inside, the hotel was pleasant, but no-frills. The lobby was small and basic, with sitting areas and magazines. I was on the ninth floor, with a view of some nearby buildings and nothing that exciting. The room was also no-frills, but it certainly got the job done. The room had plenty of open area, including a spartan but usable desk for my computer. Getting online was easy enough. It was a good base of operations for getting around Berlin (and to Potsdam) via subway and bus, both of which have lines within a three minute walk. It was also helpful with a few neighborhood bars, cafes, and stores nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly hotel, right in the centre of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MuenchenKarin Posted by an Ameropa traveler
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the buffet breakfast varied and generous and the beds comfortable. The room could do with a wee spruce-up and the shower temperature was uncomfortably variable. Despite that, I can't fault what we got for the price we paid and the location is super - only a hop and a skip from the nearest underground, close to shops, bars, banks and restaurants and a good base from which to explore Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kjonesy88
Reviews.Content: This was a brilliant hotel which was really good value for money. It is the perfect location for a trip to the city, really close to all the shops, the underground station and lots of restaurants. The hotel was extremely clean and looked very nice. The staff were extremely helpful! I would recommend it to anyone! I stayed with my friend, we are both in our early 20's and would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot for the shops”
Reviews.Author: Mosobucks
Reviews.Content: As with a previous reviewer, we stayed there over the New Year weekend. Booked a triple room, which turned out to be a standard twin with an extra bed squeezed in. Not really a problem as we only used the room to wash, sleep and stow our gear. The hotel is a fairly standard 3-star with pleasant helpful staff. Breakfast was quite good, find a table and a smiley waitress instantly appears with pot of coffee. I've seen bigger selections but all the usual items are available, even a 'make your own waffle' machine. The hotel bar seemed a bit pricey, but there's a bar directly across the street which opens late (although it can get a little smoky in there). The nearest tube station (Wittenbergplatz) is only 200m from the hotel, and is probably the best way to get around the city. There are single trip, day/multi-day and group tickets available so do your research. Another 50m and you're outside the KaDeWe (advertised as Germany's biggest department store). Well worth a look. There are many other shops along this road too, and the Xmas market and lights made for a pleasant sight after dark. The Europa centre is an amiable shopping mall; the basement holds a large Irish bar with nightly live music, though their prices are on the high side. The area felt perfectly safe and there are a number of good Italian restaurants/bistros scattered around. The famous Berlin zoo is also close by.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay over new year 2012”
Reviews.Author: JoCaMo
Reviews.Content: First time in Berlin, and very happy with this hotel. Compared to several of the photos on here, our room seemed slightly updated e.g. it came with a plasma/LCD screen TV fixed to the wall as standard. Best thing about the room was the shower room (no bath in our room). Tiled pretty much floor to ceiling and also with a full width mirror. Hairdryer incorporated in the bathroom fittings. First time I've been tempted to use the bar in a hotel! Although it's right beside the reception it was nicely decorated. They have a happy hour each evening from 5pm-7pm with cocktails priced at €5 (average usual price is €8.50). We had several, and they were good. There were a couple of details letting you know that this isn't a five star hotel e.g. on waking, I could see a couple of small holes in the curtains which were in need of repair, however, on the flip-side is the fact that the curtain material was good quality, the curtains were lined, and there were also sheer curtains for the daytime. I guess I'm trying to say that it's quality, but not luxury, which we were very happy with at this price. By the way, there are two lifts which service the hotel excellenty (i.e. very quick, smooth, never had to wait long for one)

Reviews.Title: “don't go there !!!”
Reviews.Author: Rony61
Reviews.Content: Which is a hotel for 5 nights terrible. We had a number of 573 furnished with old-fashioned, the size of a box that pair can not move there comfortably. This time our Thursday in Berlin, in other hotels, and have never met in a room so bad. There is no minibar, no safe in the room we asked to keep to our valuables in the hotel safe, we were charged. When I complained about the room we were told that other rooms. room miles away from the elevator and then day trip to Berlin tires you have walked such a room. We strongly recommend not to stay in this hotel, there are hotels in that area at that payment level of maintenance and much better service. We travel at least once a year in Berlin and will never return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome breakfast,”
Reviews.Author: pascalpierre
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sorat Berlin in the Bayreutherstrasse for 4 nights July 27th thru 31, and the hotel is really nice. I had a room on the 5th floor, room 573. Old, tired, no safe, no minibar, leaking windows BUT great breakfast! I had paid 163,- euros for the 4 nights, which is dirt cheap so I shouldn't complain....) The location off the K'dam is to^p notch and die U-Bahn is just 2minutes away. The best part was Breakfast!!!!!! A real feast with cheeses, sausages, bread of all king, coffee, tea, juices, eggs in various combinations, cereal and croissants and others waffles!!! Wow! The best bkst I had ever had! and they only charge you € 10,- ... incredible! Now considering the price I paid, I should say I had a great DEAL! I will come back.......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: barabas75
Reviews.Content: Although not the most luxurious hotel in Berlin, for the price I was very impressed. The room was extremely clean (although the previous occupant had been a smoker - often an issue in Berlin), the staff helpful and courteous, and the breakfast substantial. All for £29 per night!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Carlton95
Reviews.Content: A bit far from the main attractions of Berlin, but close to public transport. Breakfast buffet is great. If you don't speak German, the TV is no use - 15 channels, all in German! Overall, not a bad place, good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Dependable good accommodation in great location”
Reviews.Author: jgb10011
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Ambassador, and while I cannot rate the accommodations as outstanding in any way, I always return for at least my first few one to two nights every trip to Berlin, because there are never any bad surprises. With only one exception ever (the man working the front desk overnight during my April stay), ALL the staff have always been friendly and helpful in every way. The room is comfortable and spotlessly clean, and the breakfast buffet (10 Euros) the best in the neighborhood. The location is a short walk to KaDeWa, the U-Bahn, the Zoogarten S-Bahn lines, the airport express bus, the zoo and aquarium, and plenty of food and retail choices. Since the other nearby hotels are also good, I would not pay more to stay here, but for even money or less, it is a dependable choice. Note: I do not believe the rooms have A/C, so I might be reluctant to stay here during the very hot summer months. One more thing VERY important to me is FREE and good WiFi throughout hotel, rare in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT BASE FOR BERLIN TRIP”
Reviews.Author: sheiladeeCheshire
Reviews.Content: i read other peoples reviews and was a little nervous about booking this hotel . no need to worry, my husband +i booked this for a 4 day break upon arrival we were offered upgrade room at a cost of 10 euros per night we asked to see the room we had been allocated first .The room was large bright +airy the bed had spotless crisp white sheets +duvet the bathroom clean with fluffy white towels so we kept the room , we didn't think we needed upgrade, as it was only base to come back to shower +change +sleep. The staff where excellent .The buffet breakfast at 10 euros each a little expensive as we are not big breakfast eaters .so we found a little cafe bar just round corner who do fruit +croissant+coffee for 4euros . they also have the cheapest beers large one for 2-50 most places are about almost 5 euros . There are plenty of restaurants with in a couple of mins walk ,.we ate at hotel one night food lovely but in the evening its bar food i would recommend this hotel if your on a sight seeing break as everything you will need is on the doorstep .

Reviews.Title: “Great ITB stay in Ambassador Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AKK2050
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Sorat Ambassador Hotel during ITB and enjoyed every bit of it. It is very conveniently located within everything. The rooms are the same size you will find in Europe but they are clean. The restaurants are nice in ambience and food is great. I loved the breakfast every morning and of course the bar in the evening. Staff is very polite, courteous and attentive. I was always greeted with smiles at the Front desk and in the bar next to it. Same was the case in F & B breakfast and with their staff. The little touches they do are great like complimentary drinks that get offered after a busy day at ITB is just fantastic touch. The sandwich lunch they pack is nice and delicious. Thank you so much for a wonderful stay and keep up the good work. Don't let some unnecessary criticism put you down. We will be back to enjoy the great German hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Needs air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: fmpBelfast
Reviews.Content: Hotel was good value and room was very good for the price paid, but staying in Berlin in the summer really requires an air conditioned room. Sleep quality poor due to the oppressive heat. Staff pleasant and professional, and location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: robinj_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights. The location is perfect just 200 metres from the U-bahn station and 5 minutes walk from the shopping area and the Zoo. There are lots of restaurants around the area so it is not a problem that there is no restaurant in the hotel. The rooms don't have coffee-making facilities so you have to go downstairs and pay for one from a machine in reception.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value...Again”
Reviews.Author: mklein818
Reviews.Content: Once again, the Ambassador delivered - this time with a room upgrade as well as a fabulous breakfast and a superb-value price. This place has now become my Berlin-favorite hotel. It still has a "Westalgie" feel to it due to its location near the iconic KaDeWe department store on the KuDamm, but the renovated rooms are delightful if less timewarpish.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: scarperia
Reviews.Content: I have used this Hotel several times in the past years, however the quality of services has declined quite a bit. The positive points are: A) Location B) The breakfast buffet. The negatives are: 1)Indifference of most of the employes 2) No air conditionig 3) No safety deposit box in the room, the one at the FO chages you euros 1.50 per day to use it. 4) Booked with free Internet, did not worked , they charge you for the use of the one in the lobby. 5) Electric wire of the hair dryer ihang directely in the sink...very dangerous 6) Mini bar door is locked and a horrible sign is attached on the door telling you that this is not any longer a mini bar 7) Room not cleaned before 4 PM, even after I expressed to have the room cleaned by 1PM not attention was given to my request. This Hotel with a proper management and supervison could be a super place to spend a few days in Berlin..

Reviews.Title: “outdated room”
Reviews.Author: nurse-cabby
Reviews.Content: we had a twin room which seemed to be in the extended part of the hotel. the room was awlful, stunk of stale cigarette smoke, bathroom was in bad need of a refurb, cupboard doors didnt slide open just got stuck about 10 inches open. by the looks of some of the photos posted we must have got one of the worst rooms. good points, comfy beds and good shower. didnt have breakfast included so cant comment on that. close to a tube station which was great for travelling around to see the sites. a few resturants nearby also, had a couple of nice meals. we travelled to three countries on our trip and this was by far the most expensive and the worse hotel. mainly due to the smell in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller12358
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpfull staff, the best location, wonderfull bed, only one thing why i would not go back, they dont have minibar in room.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, but ok”
Reviews.Author: Arv0
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at Sorat Ambassador. My room was clean and spacious enough for me alone. Bit outdated, but who cares? My bed was not the most comfortable I ever slept in, but ok. I missed coffee/tea making facilities. There is free wi-fi, but the connection is not reliable (and for 2 days I could not connect at all) Breakfast is ok. Enough choice, even if you'd like an English Breakfast (which I do..) Leaving my suitcase after checking out so I could visit Berlin on my last day there and picking it up later was no problem. Staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “7 nights- and I will be happy to return”
Reviews.Author: gur_23
Reviews.Content: I had a great week in Berlin, amazing sights during the day and a good hotel to come back to at night. I opted for the regular rooms (budget traveler that I am), got a good deal on a B&B package, and did not regret it one bit. Things got on to a great start, check inn was quick, no more than a minute, and the staff friendly and helpful. The room itself was a good size. Very clean, and no frills. The bed made for a good night sleep, and the bathroom was nice as well. Judging by the room I expected a good, straight forward meal for breakfast, but was amazed to find quite a feast- good selection of bread, cheese, cold cuts, fish, meat, and healthier options as well (but why ruin a good vacation?). My 2 favorites at breakfast were the make your own waffle station, and the 14 kind of teas to choose from. The hotel also boasts great location, secure area to come back to at night, shopping close by of all sorts (including food store open until 10 PM, and a market in the square 3 days a week). The room was quiet as well, no noise to speak of from neighboring rooms or from the quiet street outside. I'd recommend this hotel without hesitation, and look forward to another stay there myself.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, not great location”
Reviews.Author: hicksvilleha
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel. It's fine, nothing special. Although modern in look one is constantly confronted with the low ceilings and boxy spaces of what was a 06s or 70s build. The bed was spacious and comfy. The staff were friendly in a functional was. It is locatedn in West Berlin and so is some distance away from the historical part of town which is in the East. Next time in Berlin we will look for someplace more modern in the historical East.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: 1globetrotterSweden
Reviews.Content: A little boring 70's hotel but with great location just off Wittenbergplatz in the central of Berlin. No minibar, and still with keys that you have to leave at reception every time. Lacks any kind of charm but can be very priceworthy!!

Reviews.Title: “The carpet is not new, but the important things are in order. Nice service, nice location, good brakfast. A nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: mariusblue
Reviews.Content: It is a very friendly place to stay. All the facilities and very kind and helpful staff. The service is exellent, but the hotel is not new. It is clean and tidy, but have the interior from some years ago. Very good breakfast. It is not much more than 100 meters from the KaDeWE in the busy shopping area Kurfurstendamm, and the U-bahn station Wittenbergplats is in between. Still it lies in a nice and quiet street with little traffic. I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It Should Have Come Down With The Wall”
Reviews.Author: americanstudent89
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the tripadvisor reviews about this hotel, my friend and I were looking forward to our 4 night stay here after 6 nights previously spent at similarly well-reviewed hotels in Vienna, and then Prague. When we arrived at the Ambassador Hotel, it was unseasonably warm in Berlin, highs in the mid 80s and very humid. The staff was very friendly and notified us that our room had been upgraded from a standard room, which we had booked through expedia, to a comfort room (minus the privilege of the key to the floor fridge, which contained gas water, juice, and beer, and could be attained for 10 euro per day if we wanted). Upon arriving in the room, it was unbearably hot. We quickly learned that there was no air conditioning and were utterly astounded by the fact that a hotel could exist in 2010, charge these rates, portray such a high and trendy image, and lack the simple commodity of air conditioning. We were only given one very small fan to gain air from the window, but attained a second one by asking a different reception employee. The room was extremely dated, as was the whole hotel in general, it seemed that nothing had been fully updated since first construction, aside from several inadequate upgrades that did not provide much comfort to the guests. On our third day, the pipe connecting the toilet to the water tank was somehow disconnected, and as soon as the toilet flushed, water gushed into our bathroom and quickly flooded onto the carpet. The staff, though unconcerned, quickly moved us to another room on the same floor. After reading the reviews on tripadvisor which absolutely raved about the hotel's breakfast, we really looked forward to our first morning meal. One man here went so far as calling it a "breakfast paradise". We quickly realized that this man had a very warped view of "paradise", and found the breakfast to be mediocre at best. The free wireless internet was very spotty, and only properly worked about 50% of the time we tried to use it. The reviews about the location of this hotel was a main reason we chose it, but the location is only desirable if you are traveling to Berlin to shop, as it is near many stores. If you want to sightsee, do not stay here! Though the U-Bahn metro station is very nearby, it takes about 20 minutes, and a transfer or two to reach many of the tourist sights. The staff at this hotel were very friendly, professional, and helpful, and we had no complaints about them.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible attitude of personal.”
Reviews.Author: Filio49
Reviews.Content: Fourth visit to Berlin this year. Never experiensed worse hotel than this. Location is ok. Rooms are terrible, almost no place for clothes, no minibar/refrigirator, NO A/C, decor from 70`. A comfort romm mean you get 1 bottle of water!. Reservated a smoking room. Dissapointed when this was not available, but the biggest dissapointment was the attitude of the reception personal. Rude, not helpful, "leave if you want" attitude, stayed for 4 days and they refused to write down my wish to change room. Humiliating every day to ask same question and see them answer "no" with a smile without even chequing on the computor. NEVER THIS HOTEL AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE overall”
Reviews.Author: B0nv0yage007
Reviews.Content: I would have rated this hotel "Very Good" if it weren't for some flaws such as cleanliness, and some worn out / torn out curtains and a mediocre heater. I just spent over 10 days in this hotel during what is referred as one of the coldest winter in Berlin. As I turned on the heat at max, the room was still very cold, and a single poor quality comforter won't keep you warm at night. The service is ok depending on who's handling the hotel desk unfortunately. It drastically varies from the nicest and helpful person, to the meanest. Overall, if you book this hotel online and benefit from the discounts offered by Expedia for instance, it's truly a terrific value. The Location is spot on. Walking distance from the U-ban Wittenberg Platz, served by many nearby buses, it's really : Location, Location, Location! Should you book that hotel, you should request a more modern room. They randomly allocate their rooms that cost the same amount of money. Those with a shower only are ugly and old. Bottom line, with these elements in mind, the traveller will make the best of that hotel. Plus: Location Plus: Free WiFi Plus: Abundant breakfast Plus: Great value if booked online with discounts Minus: Not very clean (greasy dust on the back of the bathroom doorknob) Minus: Mediocre heaters Minus: Unequal service Minus: Poor command of English

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location (breakfast excellent)”
Reviews.Author: tbyrd3080
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel same day and got a rate of a little over $100/night. The hotel has a great location, which is a short walk from the airport bus drop-off point (Zoological garden stop X9 bus). It's an even shorter walk to the Wittenbergplatz U-Bahn station. The room was spacious. We had two beds, but they were pushed together. Not a big deal because we're brothers (and there was enough space and distinction between the beds where there wasn't much rollover potential). The bathroom was large and very clean. It was very cold when we went and the room was warm. The best part of our stay was definitely the breakfast. Maybe I'm just not used to how the Germans do things, but there were Belgian waffles, various cooked meats, cold cuts, many varieties of cheeses, many varieties of fish, bread, fresh fruit, great juices and water, you name it. Definitely an excellent way to start the day. The staff was pretty friendly, didn't have much interaction with them beyond check-in and out. Would definitely recommend this hotel for the location, quality of rooms, and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Well loacted and a very good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Rouwen
Reviews.Content: First of all it is loacted in Berlin West, which is not the fancy new Berlin everybody hears about. But it is well conneceted by bus and tube to all the tourist attractions. Bus (No. 100) takes you in 10 minutes to Reichstag and Brandenburg Gate and a tube ride to Potsdamer Platz only takes 15 min. It is also in short walking distance to the Zoo and the famous shopping mall KaDeWe. The hotel itself does not charm you with its exterior and if you are not in love with the retro design look of the seventies the interior won´t be yours as well. But the service is well above average (friendly and very helpful), the rooms are of reasonable size and clean and the bathroom is large enough to feel comfortable. The breakfast at the hotel is very good as it offers a wide range of options (fresh fruits, bread, cheese, sausages, bacon, beans, variety of joghurt, good choice of pastry, coffee and all kinds of tea). The breakfast room has enough capacity to handle the morning rush hour. There is also a bar and a restaurant in the hotel. Both are fine and after a long day exploring the city you are not to forced to leave the hotel to have a drink or a decent meal. We stayed at the weekend, thus we did not have any problems with traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: WMBF
Reviews.Content: I stood at the Sorat Ambassador from October 31st to November 4th. My first room was not fancy, but comfortable enough. In the first night, I noticed there was a spoiled lamp, and in the morning I requested that the lamp was fixed; as they couldn't solve the problem, they offered me another room, right beside my first room (what made the transference easier). The new room was similar to the first one, but even better, as it was bigger and had a bathtube where I could relax after walking during the whole day. The only drawback is that sometimes I could smell cigar (maybe some "neighbour" was smoking...). Another positive aspects: the wi-fi internet was free, the breakfast was great, the staff was very friendly and helpful and the location is amazing (about 200m from the subway station and 400m from KaDeWe). I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: jillandbarry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a couple of friends for 3 days. hotel in good location, easy to get to from airport. Breakfast as everyone else says is first class, everything you could wish for. We had our meals at the restaurant a few doors down from the hotel, which was excellent and very reasonably priced. Our room was o.k., a bit dated but very clean All in all very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “A bit 1970s, but the 70s were cool”
Reviews.Author: edpurs999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated for the western side of Berlin, which is the shopping bit not the cultural bit. If you like shopping this is the place, KaDeWe (big shop) is 5 mins from the hotel and KuDam (big shopping street) is a couple more minutes. Tiergarten (big park) is close, the train is almost outside the door. It is a little shabby but ok. Breakfast was fine, it was a typical buffet, able to stock up for the day! Free Wifi as well, which is great. Only English language TV station is CNN, no minibar (probably a good thing), and a cheap supermarket around the corner. Perfect for the cheapskate traveller!!

Reviews.Title: “Fair but not so great”
Reviews.Author: BeBe030
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Good location - Breakfast was nice but not great Cons: - Wifi connection did not work and personnell did not help with the problem. - No safety locker in rooms (safety locker in lobby was not free of charge) - Hotel personnell was not so friendly and helpful. I noticed that some of them were quite rude to some customers who had problems with internet connection they had paid. - No air condition. It was very hot :( - Rooms were quite dirty - Everything paid - cappuchino in breakfast, internet, safety locker.. I would recommend to search another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: sicamous
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable rooms. Excellent breakfast. A stone's throw from a U-Bahn station, restaurants & shopping nearby, close to Ku'damm St. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: meg1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sorat Ambassador for 5 nights in March 2009. The location is excellent as the hotel is less than 5 minutes' walk from both the underground and bus and is just round the corner from the KaDeWe. The hotel is quite dated; according to the blurb in the room this was the first 5 star hotel in west Berlin and our room certainly didn't look like it had been modernized since! It was clean and comfortable though and fine if you're only using it to sleep in and to give it it's due, I think there were some more modern rooms which were probably more expensive than the rate we paid. The staff were really nice, breakfast was good and on the whole we definitely couldn't argue with it for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel Ideally Located”
Reviews.Author: Me_Shell_H
Reviews.Content: My Husband took me to Berlin for my Birthday and we booked in this hotel on a family recommendation. Having got a bargain price for this hotel which is sitauted so closely to a Ubahn station we were a bit dubious however i wouldnt hesitate to recomend for friends and family to stay here. Whilst the hotel is not fantastic we primarily used it as a base for sight seeing and as it was so close to Wittenburgplatz it was more than ideal. The breakfast provided each morning is outstanding, i have seen little better across europe and we always found the staff helpful and polite. we did spend most evenings in the bar and whilst it wasnt cheap it wasnt too extortionate either. we also had the pizza room service which was fantastic value. The rooms are basic but more than comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of extra charges”
Reviews.Author: Kalee_9
Reviews.Content: While I paid for and booked a double room in advance, I was also charged 20 Euros per night for the extra person from the hotel and as an added insult--they charged me for the call to the travel service in an attempt to straighten it out. All told, it was an extra 200 Euros for the stay! Just before I left, I discovered other travelers who had also encountered extra charges for the "free" breakfast and other things like "free" wireless internet. Excellent breakfast for sure but I had a very bad taste in my mouth when I checked out anyway. There service staff is very accommodating but their front desk people look and act like military personnel. My advice they need to rewrite their room descriptions about their hotel at various sites unless this deception is a deliberate attempt to get more money for their rooms and displease guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Jason1980
Reviews.Content: We are a gay couple that stayed at Sorat Ambassador from December 19 to 23, 2008. POSITIVE: - Fantastic location directly at Wittenbergplatz with its tube/underground station, and so only few steps away from Tauentzienstrasse with all its shops including KaDeWe as well as the gay district Fuggerstrasse/ Motzstrasse/ Nollendorfplatz. - Best value for your money: We paid less than EUR 250.- (!) for 4 nights in a so-called comfort room, which probably means a bit spacier and you got an electric kettle in your room. Unfortunately the drink dispenser on the floor was locked, but as comfort room guests, we probably would have received a key if we had asked for one since the comfort rooms include free drinks. - Good breakfast buffet, included in the room price. - Very clean. - Friendly staff. - Quiet. NEGATIVE: - Nothing really. I could at most mention the long corridor, if your room is at the end of it. ;-) If a room is available in the same price range, I will definitely stay at Sorat Ambassador again on my next Berlin trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: scarperia
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel for the price, breakfast is excellent, the only negative are the front desk employees, mostly quite rude and arrogant, they definetely need training in how to deal with the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a city break!”
Reviews.Author: saoirsechick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal if you are on a weekend to Berlin and just need somewhere to put your head down at night. Although basic, the rooms are large and clean. The hotel staff are efficient and friendly, always happy to help you with directions etc. The breakfast in the hotel is excellent, offering a wide selection of hot and cold food. We particularly liked the waffle machine for making our own waffles! In the hotel reception there are a various leaflets for all the sights of Berlin, and the zoo is only a 5 minute walk away. It's about a 10 minute walk to zoo station where you can get a train to all the main sights in the east and only takes about 10 minutes. Around the hotel itself there are plenty of bars and restaurants and the department store Ka DeWe is just around the corner, as well as many many other shops, and they were setting up the Christmas market as we were leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Central,clean,comfortable with superb breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jamie_from_london
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Standard double at the end of August with our four year old. A couple of minutes from the Wittenbergplatz U-Bahn, & 5-10 minutes walk from Zoo' U-Bahn, with many restaurants, takeaways, cashpoint, late-night supermarket & market nearby. Found all reception staff very helpful and friendly. Room clean & comfortable with shower & bath, & curious double room door which provided good noise insulation. Bar was pricy, but with generous snack portions. Were able to check in over three hours early & leave luggage after checking out. Buffet breakfast was exceptional; vast choice of cereals (& seeds!), hot sausage, chicken, eggs & bacon, make your own waffles (& we did!), fruit salads, yoghurts, rolls, jams (in , pastries, cold meats, smoked salmon & cheeses, juices, teas & even Sekt in an ice bucket! Only quibble was that the (large) breakfast room was very busy between 8-9am (breakfast served 06.30-11.00hrs), and we had a few minutes delay finding a table & had to ask for a jug of coffee, but this is nitpicking, overall a comfortable place to recover from & set you up for more sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but beware, no A/C!”
Reviews.Author: Diana69
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in excellent location near Kurferstendamm, KaDeWe, U-bahn, Zoo, and main train station. Only reason I haven't rated this hotel "Excellent" is because they don't have AC. If you're visiting during a cooler month, would highly recommend due it's central location, friendly staff, clean rooms and one of the best breakfast buffets we had in Germany. If you're visiting during a hot summer month, can't recommend this one. Staff was friendly and apologetic and offered us another fan - there was already one in the room - and gave us ice cubes. Couldn't sleep with window open due to the cigarette smoke that would fill up the room. Beer in the bar was 5 Euro, a bit high. Not the way we wanted to spend our last night in Germany - hot and sticky, but otherwise a great hotel. I'm amazed that in all the reviews I read on this hotel that no one mentioned no A/C. But at 95F days and 90F nights, A/C is just a must for us.

Reviews.Title: “mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: John_Lewis
Reviews.Content: If I was writing this review the first night I arrived at the SORAT Ambassador, chances are I would be giving it one star, but I stayed for five nights and my experience did get notably better over time. The hotel is a curious one, it seems to be a refit of a 70s hotel, but I'm not quite sure that much has been refitted. I feel to convey an accurate impression of my first night at the hotel I have to include a conversation I had with a receptionist the next morning Me: The fridge in my room seems to be locked Receptionist: There is no fridge Me: Then why is there a sticker on a locked cupboard saying 'please don't open this' R: That used to be a fridge, none of the rooms have fridges now Me: Oh, well there's no safe in my room R: There are no safes Me: Oh, well the air conditioning in my room doesn't seem to be working R: There is no air conditioning Me (puzzled): Then what's the box blowing out cold air in my room? R: That used to be an air conditioning unit This was all a bit weird. The non air conditioning unit was blowing out cold air but it wasn't possible to change the temperature. The unit also seemed very shabby (see picture). Also, I had two single beds in my room, and one broke immediately when I sat down on it. And the bathroom was very dimly lit. All in all then, it wasn't the best of first impressions - however, the hotel is not all bad and has some redeeming features. The bed I did sleep on was comfortable, the rooms were clean, if a bit retro, and they did have satellite TV. What's more, the location is excellent, right on top of an U-Bahn station and only ten mins walk from Bahnhof Zoologischer Garten, and very near the Kurfuestendamm. The zoo is only two or three minutes walk away too, and so is the Tiergarten. The shower in the room was good (although the stuck on the wall all-in-one shampoo/shower gel wasn't so great), and the breakfast was excellent, serving for a long time and really giving a wide range of choices. I was there five nights and I really could have had something different every night. Staff were by and large friendly and helpful too. But in the end, I wouldn't actually recommend staying at this hotel, there were too many things wrong with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: upstategal_8
Reviews.Content: Hotel was conveniently located steps from a subway station and key bus routes. Desk staff was friendly and very helpful at booking tours and providing directions. Only downside was lack of air conditioning in rooms, but in May, it was fine and could open windows to let cool air in when it got warm. Breakfast had a lot of variety and was very good! Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms fit for a youth hostel”
Reviews.Author: Oilbert
Reviews.Content: I checked tripadvisor before booking this. But ... where did these people stay? Certainly not in the room that we're in right now! Furniture with chipped off paint everywhere. A bis sticky spill of (I hope) Coke on the desk. There's a small door here with a tiny sticker saying: "This door is locked, no minibar." hmmm. And I have not been able to locate the fridge with the free drinks. There's a coke vending machine by the lifet. Coke for 2 EUR. Certainly no free drinks. I still have the knob of the wardrobe door lying here next to ma computer. The toilet flush need lots of jiggling to stop flushing. The window opens fine but I had quite a task trying to get it back into its frame to close it again. Certainly not a hotel I would recommend. We're moving out tomorrow morning to find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for older travelers”
Reviews.Author: linnmac
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in early April at the Ambassador. I had a good quality room for the price: 20% discount for a 4-night stay, about 72.00/night USD for a single, including a huge and varied buffet in an attractive breakfast room each AM. A plus at breakfast--large carafes of hot coffee at each table. Just off the Ku-damm and the former middle of West Berlin, this hotel was perfect for the older traveler not looking for the nightlife of the Mitte, etc. It was close to U-Bahn, and an easy walk to Zoo train station and connections to the rest of Berlin and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sorat Ambassador”
Reviews.Author: Mtabakman
Reviews.Content: Nice location only a couple of blocks from the U-Bahn in the former West Berlin. Clean hotel room. Breakfast was very extensive and had something for everyone -- and it was included with the room too! Refrigerator on each floor stocked with complimentary beer, water, and Coke was a nice touch! Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fryinpanbelfast
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay in. The hotel staff were very friendly and polite and always helpful. The breakfast buffet served almost everything you could want. The hotel is centrally located, taking only 2 minutes to walk to the KaDeWe (and the Kurfustendamn) and 5 minutes to the zoo. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definately book it again when returning to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Value - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BJM
Reviews.Content: Booked here via Ryanair website - for absolute bargain price (i.e. £35 a night). Hotel is in good location right by U station and minutes away from main shops including KaDeWe (a must visit is the food halls). Hotel is contemporary (not very trendy though) and clean. Room was a good size, clean and with large bathroom. Proper double bed - not two singles pushed together. Everything in the room was good - only small niggles were the height of the shower (bit low for my 6ft 4" husband) and the TV reception was not great for CNN. No minibar but soft drinks available from machine in corridor. Hotel bar and reception was good - with friendly and helpful staff. Real plus was the great breakfasts - huge array of hot and cold buffett items... constantly replenished. We thought this hotel represented excellent value for money - would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Shabby Room”
Reviews.Author: EEF1792
Reviews.Content: Although the Ambassador was well located,had a pleasant and helpful staff, and good food service, I will probably not stay there again. My single room was shabby with wallpaper peeling off the wall, a clean but threadbare carpet,and dated furniture. As a single traveller, I was only allowed one pillow on the double bed and one towel in the bath. The ventilation in the lobby was poor so the cigarette smoke was toxic.

Reviews.Title: “ambassador hotel”
Reviews.Author: carlit0
Reviews.Content: we found this hotel in berlin fantastic!!! it is really good located in the centre of berlin, only a few steps away from the main atttractions. There were no negative things about this hotel!!! Many good ones!!! -situated in the very centre (few steps away from underground "wittenbergsplatz") - clean rooms and just renovated bathrooms - the people at the frontdesk were very professional - breakfast included in the price ( Very very nice breakfastbuffét) I would warmly recommend this hotel in berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A warming experience”
Reviews.Author: n1cks
Reviews.Content: We’ve recently returned from a weekend break in Berlin where we stayed at the Ambassador Hotel. This hotel doesn’t pull any punches but merely “does what it says on the tin.” We arrived late Thursday evening and were ushered to our “standard double room” only to find that it was actually a twin room. This coupled with the fact that the room was boiling hot and lacked air conditioning hardly made for a good first impression. After a rather sweaty night’s sleep I approached the concierge to enquire about changing rooms. They were only to happy to show me another room, which for an extra 15 euros per night gave me a double bed, a larger bathroom, bathrobes, a much needed fan and access to the complimentary drinks fridge in the hall. I duly accepted and it proved to be well worth the dosh. Breakfast was a hot/cold buffet open from 7-11am and was perfectly acceptable although a little tedious by the third day. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful and spoke superb English. Location wise the Ambassador hotel isn’t great. It’s situated near to the Zoologischer Garten station (similar to London’s King’s Cross) and isn’t really near the Mitte (the hub of Berlin life). This of course meant taking public transport which as you’d expect, is extremely punctual and efficient. Overall, we’d have to stay that this hotel serves a purpose but be warned there is no air conditioning and I would advise against staying here during the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Go there for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: John074
Reviews.Content: We often stay in hotels in Berlin, most of the time 5 star hotels. On our way to Poland we stayed in Kempinski (terrible, see review). On our way back we stayed in this 3 star hotel and didn't expect that much. But we were surprised, the hotel is simple but nicely done (you don't need to spend much money to make something nice). The rooms are big for a 3 star hotel (certainly compared to a 5 star hotel like Kempinski) and are in a good condition. The only disadvantage is that when it is really hot , it can be very hot in the room because we didn't have airco (I don't know about other rooms). Breakfast was the biggest surprise. This can beat breakfasts in many 5 star hotels! Lots of choice, make your own pancakes, champaign, etc. We liked the variety of the people (compared to some other hotels) and in combination with the low price, the excellent breakfast and the central location, I would say 'check it out'.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean room but not very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: MichaelPD
Reviews.Content: The hotel was typical business class Good: Great buffet and restaurant and good service/staff at the restaurant. Room was nice and clean. Bad: Some of the front desk staff were downright rude. There were a couple of nice ones though. The clientele were business people and vacationers on the conservative/rude side. Elevators were very slow. Very good: location to Ku'Damm, KaDeWe, gay district. The internet cafe across the street , staff was friendly and usage was cheap . Don't use the hotel's PCs for internet, they charge too much. There is a local restaurant two buildings up the street, the waitress and hosts are very nice and the food was very good, typical German. The market by park was also good. I won't stay here again due to the unfriendliness of the staff. Overall, i didn't care for Berlin as everything was spreadout, the people I encountered weren't very friendly. I cancelled Cologne to stay in Berlin for a couple of days more, I should have stuck to my original itinerary.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - incredible value for money. Book there NOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: Evan76
Reviews.Content: I ve stayed at the Ambassador Sorat Hotel in August 2006 for a 5-nights city break. I have only good things to say about the hotel (and the lovely city of Berlin - but thats somehow irrelevant I guess :-) First of all I got a great price of 72 euros/per night for a single room. My other options started at about 100 e+ and I seriously doubt they were any better. The location of the hotel is almost perfect. Its about 100m from a central U-bahn station (Wittenberg Platz) which serve 4 lines! The 'platz' itself is very nice and spacious with 4 'imbis' ( wurst stalls) at its 4 corners. I had a delicious curry-wurst every night on my way back to the hotel! The KaDeWe store is at the side of the square and Kurfurstendam with its loads of shops begins just 500m away. So, the location is very central, with very easy U-Bahn access and some sights right at your doorstep, like the KaDeWe and the Ruins of the bombarded church (cant remember the name right now). Also do try the wurst in the imbis you meet when exiting the station and going to the hotel! The room was very spacious (for european standards at least). It had a king size bed ( I guess it was really a double-bed ), it was very clean, had a mini-bar, big screen TV ( not the usual 14"), nice ambient lighting, a sparkling clean bathroom with excellent shower water presure. One thing that I ve never met before was the fact that it had double doors! There was an outer standard door with the lock and then another one with no lock. The double doors worked very well in blocking noise from the hallways. I really liked that feature. The only thing missing from the room was air-conditioning. I think there are ACs in the more premium rooms, but mine being a basic standard one, lacked it. However that didnt turn out to be much of a problem since the weather was cool enough, even in the middle of August, that I didnt really miss it at all. And I m someone who normally has the AC working 24/7 during the summer, but in Berlin there was no need for it. The staff was friendly enough and replied to my requests. The breakfast was good, although nothing really special. Overall it was a great experience and I ll defenitely stay there again, should I return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvr1
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Ambassador. It is in a prime locaton for shopping. It is an older hotel, so don't expect a fancy 21st century property. You get a clean nice room, good TV, nice bath. The hotel has double doors leading into the room, so you get less noise from the hallway, saying that however, I heard no noise from the hallway at anytime. The lobby is very nice, and the staff helpful and friendly. The buffet breakfast in the morning is fantastic, one of the best I have seen. Large breakfast room looking out on the passing street scene. If I go back to Berlin I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: hoki
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend. Staff pleasant enough but have a little trouble with conversational english. Rooms very clean. Buffet breakfast satisfactory. Only drawback would be lack of air conditioning in summer - on the 6th floor the heat was suffocating. Very simple access to Ubahn.

Reviews.Title: “Best value Ambassador Hotell”
Reviews.Author: Dettes
Reviews.Content: A well run hotel with a perfect location just 300m from the nearest underground station. Berlin is a delightful city, fresh and and vibrant. I will definately return sometime in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ambassador for a week in May 2004. This is a hotel that is well deserving of three stars, but not more. The rooms are clean, the staff is friendly and the location is within steps of the Ku-Damm. What more can you ask for at this price?

Reviews.Title: “Good value; excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DaveO_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed there a year or two back for four nights. Location is excellent - in a quiet sidestreet but very convenient for what I wanted. Just off Kurfurstendamm Strasse, within 3 minutes of Ka-De-We, within five mins of nearest S-Bahn and U-Bahn stations. Hotel was clean and staff were friendly and helpful enough. Breakfast buffet was good and plentiful. We ate out for other meals so don't know what they were like - there were a load of restaurants within a few minutes walk. Would be happy to stay here again.
